overview: In 1992, a group of New York backup musicians got together to jam and take a break from their daily lives, in the process forming a group named for legendary backup player Al Kooper. With talents from the orchestras of "Late Night with Conan O'Brien" and the "Late Show with David Letterman," the Rekooperators shine in this PBS concert featuring original tunes, along with blues classics and favorite covers.
title: Al Kooper and the Rekooperators
